poem:
Title: "Coppola's Constellation"

Stardust swirls in Sofia's reel, 
where gen X dreams in Polaroid feel.
Mildred Pierce's silent tune,
echoes in a sonic moon.
Fashioned in the Milk Fed haze,
youth is a garment worn in grace. 
In films that taste of girlhood's paste,
our fleeting youth, once again traced. 
In frames, vivid dreams arise, 
Coppola, curator of time's disguise.
